French police raid far-right RN party's HQ over suspected illegal campaign financing

title: Macron turns to politics on second day of UK state visit
In Texas, vast masses of hot, humid air and extreme drought led to the fatal flooding
Fire in Marseille: Massive blaze at city's doorstep causes damage and anxiety
subhead: Driven by extremely strong winds, the fire affected dozens of homes in the north of the city and led to the evacuation of 450 people. No casualties were reported.

title: In Greece, migrant registration sites 'have shifted from a jungle model to a prison model'
subhead: '2015-2025: Europe's migration crisis' (4/5). 'Hotspots,' originally conceived as migrant registration sites, have gradually turned into closed detention centers, such as on the island of Samos, where asylum seekers now live in isolation.
byline: By Julia Pascual (Samos (Greece), special correspondent) and Samuel Gratacap (Photos)

title: Spain's Costa Blanca bears the scars of a real estate frenzy
subhead: The region of Valencia in Spain particularly suffered from the real estate frenzy that led to the 2008 financial crisis. Between 2020 and 2021, the Basque photographer Markel Redondo explored this stretch of the Mediterranean coast, which is now rimmed with concrete. His photographs capture the scars that remain from a short-sighted vision of progress.

title: China's 'black decade' for human rights lawyers
subhead: On July 9, 2015, Chinese authorities launched a sweeping crackdown on lawyers who dared to defend critics of the regime. Ten years later, the legal profession's room for maneuver has never been narrower.

How Israel tracked down and assassinated scientists involved in Iran's nuclear program
subhead: Israel's attacks in June killed 16 leading researchers involved in Iran's efforts to develop an atomic bomb. Some of them had been under Israeli intelligence surveillance for two decades. With their deaths, Israel believes it has dealt the most decisive blow yet to Tehran's military nuclear program.
byline: By Louis Imbert, Ghazal Golshiri and Liselotte Mas

title: Iranian photographer Forough Alaei portrays life during the war: 'Nothing will ever be the same again'
subhead: After the first Israeli bombings in Iran, Iranian photographer Forough Alaei left Tehran to take refuge with her family on the Caspian Sea coast. She documented those days when war plunged them into the unknown.
byline: By Forough Alaei (Photos) and Audrey Delaporte

title: Channel crossings by migrants in small boats are on the rise
subhead: Since the beginning of the year, more than 20,000 men, women and children have managed to reach the United Kingdom – 7,000 more than during the same period in 2024. At least 15 people have died while attempting the crossing.
byline: By Julia Pascual (Boulogne-sur-Mer, Dunkirk and Loon-Plage special correspondent)
